pullRequest.title: Allow `ArmeriaRetrofitBuilder` to configure `ClientOption`
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation:
If a user wants to add ClientFactory, he/she should have to create WebClient.
It is convenient to configure ClientOption when building ArmeriaRetrofit.
Modifications:

Make AbstractClientOptionsBuilder public.
Allow creating ClientOption without the default options.
Lazily build baseWebClient and nonBaseClientFactory with Retrofit client options.
Add add(ClientDecoration) to ClientDecorationBuilder
Add ClientDecoration.isEmpty()
Make ClientOptions.of(ClientOptions, ClientOptionValue...) merge options properly.
Make ClientFactoryOptions.of(ClientFactoryOptions, ClientFactoryOptionValue...) merge options properly.
Miscellaneous:

Fix Kotlin unused parameters warning



Result:

You can now directly configure ClientOptions when building ArmeriaRetrofit.
Fixes #2481

commit.message:
Allow `ArmeriaRetrofitBuilder` to configure `ClientOption`

Motivation:
If a user wants to add `ClientFactory`, he/she should have to create `WebClient`.
It is convenient to configure `ClientOption` when building `ArmeriaRetrofit`.

Modifications:
* Make `AbstractClientOptionsBuilder` public and add `@UnstableApi` annotation.
* Allow creating `ClientOption` without the default options.
* Lazily build `baseWebClient` and `nonBaseClientFactory` with Retrofit client options.

Result:
You can now directly configure `ClientOption` when building `ArmeriaRetrofit`.
Fixes #2481

nodes.bodyText:
How about moving to the internal package then?
It seems like only this class is going to be moved and done.

commit.message:
Address comments by @minwoox, @trustin

- Move AbstractClientOptionsBuilder to internal
- Add `add(ClientDecoration)` to ClientDecorationBuilder

nodes.bodyText:
Hmm, I'm not sure if it's a good idea to expose empty() in the public API. How about this:

Remove EMPTY and empty()
Change the signiture of buildOptions() to:

buildOptions(@Nullable ClientOptions baseOptions) (We pass WebClient.options() in this PR, or null for other cases.)


Use ClientOptions.of(baseOptions, optValArray) (if null, use ClientOptions.of(optValArray).

commit.message: Address comments by @trustin / Add abstract mergeValue for merge conflict option value

nodes.bodyText: Could use newValue.value() and oldValue.value() instead of calling .value() many times.

Probably better using oldValue's size + newValue's size? Not always optimal, but expansion is more expensive.
Could just return the oldValue if newValue is empty (or newValue is oldValue is empty.)
Could return oldDecoration or newDecoration if newDecoration or oldDecoration is empty respectively.
Ditto - Could optimize when either is empty.

commit.message:
Address comments by @trustin

* Add abstract `filterValue` and remove from constructor
* Avoid creating new options if either one is empty.

nodes.bodyText: How about adding ClientDecoration.isEmpty() and simplifying here?

commit.message: Miscellaneous: Fix Kotlin unused parameters warning
